alert.note: Alert for Delaware; Montgomery; Philadelphia (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 12 at 4:15PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 815 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Pennsylvania...including the following counties...Delaware, Montgomery, and Philadelphia. * WHEN...Until 815 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 413 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly across portions of the advisory area. Between 0.5 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Philadelphia, Chester, Yeadon, Folcroft, Swarthmore, Jenkintown, Narberth, East Lansdowne, Drexel Hill, Morris Park, Darby Township, and Broomall. - This includes the following highways... Interstate 95 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 0 and 9. Interstate 76 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 335 and 346. Interstate 676 in Pennsylvania near mile marker 0. Interstate 476 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 0 and 10. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
